column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column7: WiseTech is a leading developer and provider of software solutions to the global logistics industry.
As of 30 June 2023, 132 individuals were working with WiseTech Global in the following categories: students, temporary workers, casuals and contractors.

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column13: Before the appointment of any new Non-Executive Director, appropriate checks are conducted to determine whether the candidate has the capabilities needed and is fit and proper to undertake the role's responsibilities. Upon appointment, each Director receives a formal letter outlining their appointment's key terms, conditions, and expectations.
column20: Appropriate check, Non-Executive Director, formal letter

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column13: An orientation program is tailored to meet the needs of each new Director, including briefings on WiseTech's strategy, financial, operational and risk management matters, and its governance framework. As part of the Board meeting cycle, the Directors receive regular briefings on the business and key governance, regulatory and accounting developments.
column20: Orientation program, risk management, governance framework

column6: Chair of the highest governance body
column7: Mr Andrew Harrison is the chair of WiseTech's Board.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column13: WiseTech revisited its modern slavery risk assessment with the support of an independent expert advisor. WiseTech's advisors reviewed its modern slavery risk assessment and worked with its Modern Slavery Working Group to refine and update the risk assessment. This refined risk assessment will strengthen WiseTech's risk management activities on modern slavery.
column20: Modern slavery risk assessment, expert advisor, Modern Slavery Working Group

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column13: WiseTech's Human Rights Principles set out its commitment to upholding and respecting human rights for all people. They define its commitments as providing a safe and healthy workplace, complying with local employment laws and regulations and not engaging or supporting forced or compulsory labour. These principles apply across WiseTech's global businesses. It must be adhered to by its employees, contractors, directors, consultants, and all parties acting for WiseTech on its behalf, including partners and suppliers.
column20: Human Rights Principles, human rights, employment law

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column13: The Board considers various factors relevant to assessing the independence of Directors following the ASX Recommendations. The Board considers quantitative and qualitative principles of materiality to determine 'independence' on a case-by-case basis.
column20: Independence, ASX Recommendation, materiality

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column13: WiseTech values a strong and diverse workforce and is committed to diversity and inclusion in its workplace. WiseTech implemented Diversity and Inclusion Principles designed to foster a culture that values and achieves diversity in its workforce and Board.
column20: Diversity and Inclusion Principles, diversity, culture

column13: The Board selects new Director appointments following the process set by the Nomination Committee. The Directors must abide by the Code of Conduct (which includes a section on dealing with conflicts of interest). The Board maintains a register of Director interests. Any related party transactions are reviewed by the Audit & Risk Committee and are disclosed in the Financial Report.
column20: Register of Director Interest, Code of Conduct, Nomination Committee

column13: WiseTech's Whistleblower Protection Principles establish mechanisms and procedures for employees to report suspected unethical or illegal conduct in a manner that protects the whistleblower and gathers the necessary information for WiseTech to investigate such reports and act appropriately.
column20: Whistleblower Protection Principle, illegal conduct, whistleblower

column13: WiseTech's Board monitors the Group's risk management systems across its business and has delegated this oversight to the Audit & Risk Committee. Risk management is also delegated to a group of senior executives (with the CEO maintaining overall responsibility), who oversee a system of internal controls and risk management and monitor and manage those risks.
column20: Risk management system, senior executive, internal control

column6: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column13: The Board is responsible for Board succession planning, the appointment of new Directors and continuing professional development of Directors. In doing so, it has regard to the balance of skills, diversity, experience, independence and expertise on the Board. The Board uses a skills matrix that identifies the skills and experience needed to support WiseTech in achieving its strategy and meeting its regulatory and legal requirements.
column20: Skills matrix, succession planning, diversity

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column13: The Board has agreed to conduct periodic performance evaluations of itself, its committees and each Director. Generally, the evaluation process will involve the Chair holding one-to-one interviews with Directors on their performance, the performance of the Board as a whole and the performance of the committees and other Directors.
column20: Performance evaluation, one-to-one interview, Director

column13: WiseTech's future growth and innovation rely on the talent, motivation and enthusiasm of its people worldwide. WiseTech aims to reward its high-performance global workforce with a remuneration and incentive program aligned to its business strategy, specialised operations, and aspirations for sustained growth. WiseTech's remuneration framework includes cash and equity components that reward its workforce for achieving operational and strategic priorities and creating long-term sustainable value for WiseTech and its shareholders.
column20: Remuneration framework, global workforce, equity component

column13: To create a stronger alignment with shareholder interests, in addition to base salary and legislated superannuation contributions, WiseTech builds remuneration equity, an annual grant of multi-year deferred equity, into fixed base remuneration across its global workforce. It aligns employees' interests with those of shareholders, encouraging value-creating behaviours and supporting staff retention within the Group.
column20: Remuneration equity, superannuation contribution, global workforce

column7: The ratio of total compensation for the highest-paid individual to median annual total compensation was 26.7.

We are excited by the future opportunities ahead of us, and the long-term shareholder value we continue to deliver. Thank you."

column13: This year, WiseTech developed new Sustainability and ESG Principles, which guide how it integrates ESG considerations into how WiseTech supports the delivery of its Sustainability and ESG framework. Adopting the approach set out in the principles embeds sustainability considerations into WiseTech's decision-making and operations, contributing to a more sustainable future and creating long-term value for stakeholders.
column20: Sustainability and ESG Principles, ESG consideration, sustainability consideration

column13: WiseTech's Securities Trading Policy outlines the rules for Directors and employees trading in WiseTech Global securities. The policy aims to assist directors and employees in complying with their obligations under the insider trading provisions of the Corporations Act 2001 (Cth) and to protect the reputation of the company, its directors, and employees.
column20: Securities Trading Policy, insider trading, reputation

column8: Modern Slavery Incident Response, Management and Remediation Framework
column13: WiseTech is committed to upholding and respecting human rights for all people, as outlined in its Human Rights Principles. WiseTech's Modern Slavery Incident Response, Management and Remediation Framework is published on its intranet. It sets out what WiseTech will do if an instance of modern slavery is suspected or identified in its operations or supply chain.
column20: Modern Slavery Incident Response, Management and Remediation Framework, human rights, supply chain

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: WiseTech is committed to conducting business activities in an ethical, lawful and socially responsible manner and following the laws and regulations of the countries where it operates. The Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy supports the Group's Code of Conduct, particularly the Group's firm commitment to operating an ethical business organisation.
column20: Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy, business activity, responsible manner

column7: There were no significant instances of non-compliance with laws and regulations during the reporting period.

column7: Approximately 4% of WiseTech's employees globally are covered by collective bargaining agreements.

column13: Each year, WiseTech conducts a materiality assessment in line with the Global Reporting Initiative Standards (GRI Standards) to identify the most important sustainability issues to stakeholders and its business's long-term sustainability. This year, WiseTech conducted a comprehensive materiality assessment. WiseTech engaged directly with stakeholders to identify and prioritise key ESG topics.
column20: Materiality assessment, sustainability issue, ESG topic

column7: WiseTech's topics are community engagement, diversity and inclusion, and data security and privacy.

column13: During the year, WiseTech developed a Sustainability & ESG framework that sets its strategic objectives in three impact-priority areas. Strong foundations and enablers underpin these. The framework sharpens WiseTech's focus on the impact priority areas of tech education, people and culture, and net zero carbon. These are both value drivers for WiseTech's business and important, long-term challenges for which WiseTech can help lead and drive solutions.
column20: Sustainability & ESG framework, strategic objective, impact-priority area
